content.description:
Directions:

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"> <mi>f</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> </math> is a real number. Angle measures for trigonometric functions are assumed to be in radians.

Solutions to equations must be real numbers. Determine the exact value of any expression that can be obtained without a calculator. For example, <math alttext="log subscript 2 8"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>8</mn></math>, <math alttext="cos open parentheses pi over 2 close parentheses"><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>, and <math alttext="inverse sine 1"> <msup> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mfenced> <mn>1</mn> </mfenced> </math> can be evaluated without a calculator.

Unless otherwise specified, combine terms using algebraic methods and rules for exponents and logarithms, where applicable. For example, <math alttext="2 x plus 3 x"><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></math>, <math alttext="5 squared times 5 cubed"><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, <math alttext="x to the power of 5 over x squared"> <mfrac> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mfrac> </math>, and <math alttext="ln 3 plus ln 5"><mi>ln</mi><mpadded lspace="-1px"><mn>3</mn></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>ln</mi><mpadded lspace="-1px"><mn>5</mn></mpadded></math> should be rewritten in equivalent forms.

For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.
content.question:
Part A

The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are given by

<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 5 open parentheses 4 x minus 2 close parentheses"> <mi>g</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>-</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </math>

<math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals inverse sine open parentheses 8 x close parentheses"> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfenced> </math>.

(i) Solve <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>.

(ii) Solve <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals pi over 4"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>.

frqParts.text:
Part A

The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are given by

<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 5 open parentheses 4 x minus 2 close parentheses"> <mi>g</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>-</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </math>

<math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals inverse sine open parentheses 8 x close parentheses"> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfenced> </math>.

(i) Solve <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>.

(ii) Solve <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals pi over 4"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>.

Part B

The functions <math alttext="j"> <mi>j</mi> </math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> are given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>j</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>sec</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>cot</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AD6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>16</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>⋅</mo> <msup> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msup> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4741@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(i) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>j</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOAaiaayIW7caGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcaaaa@3C6D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> as an expression involving <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaci4CaiaacMgacaGGUbGaaGjbVlaadIhaaaa@3CFA@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and no other trigonometric functions.

(ii) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4AaiaacIcacaWG4bGaaiykaaaa@3ADE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> as an expression of the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mn>4</mn> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math alttext="a"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math alttext="b"> <mi>b</mi> </math> are constants.

Part C

The function <math> <semantics> <mi>m</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyBaaaa@388A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>m</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mn>3</mn> </msqrt> <mi>tan</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@471A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

Find all input values in the domain of <math> <semantics> <mi>m</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyBaaaa@388A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> that yield an output value of <math> <semantics> <mn>1</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyBaaaa@388A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
